title: Esteban José Herrera
text:
Esteban José Herrera is an <a href="Argentina">Argentine</a> <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> centre forward. He was born on March 9, 1981, in the city of <a href="Villa%20Constitucion">Villa Constitucion</a> in the <a href="Santa%20Fe%20Province">Santa Fe Province</a> of <a href="Argentina">Argentina</a>. His last team was <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Social%20y%20Deportivo%20Camioneros">Atlético Camioneros</a> in the <a href="Torneo%20Argentino%20B">Torneo Argentino B</a>.
Herrera started his career at <a href="Boca%20Juniors">Boca Juniors</a> in the <a href="Primera%20Division%20Argentina">Primera Division Argentina</a>. It was with Boca that he won his first and second major titles as a player. He was part of the squad that won the <a href="Clausura">Clausura</a> 1999 title and in 2001 he helped Boca to win the <a href="Copa%20Libertadores">Copa Libertadores</a> title.
In 2001 Herrera was part of the <a href="Argentina%20national%20under-20%20football%20team">Argentina Under-20</a> team that won the <a href="2001%20FIFA%20World%20Youth%20Championship">2001 FIFA World Youth Championship</a>.
At the end of the 2001 season Herrera left Boca for <a href="Talleres%20de%20C%C3%B3rdoba">Talleres de Córdoba</a> but after only one season with the club he moved to <a href="Italy">Italy</a> to play for <a href="F.C.%20Messina%20Peloro">F.C. Messina Peloro</a>.
